Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ski4ever64
Reviews.Content: There is nothing like waking up in the morning, going to the roof terrace and looking up at the Blue Mosque. The hotel is in a fantastic location (10 minute walk to Blue Mosque and tram lines to take you to further reaches of the city) and the staff were amazing. Tea was waiting for us when we arrived. The included breakfast was delicious and the staff helped us with maps, ideas and tours around the city. I would gladly reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “city break”
Reviews.Author: Julie O
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay in this hotel. Staff friendly. Gave us good information on local sites. Blue mosque 5 mins away. Tram connections 5 mins away.Breakfast buffet good catered for all nationalities. resturants nearby. roof terrace had nice views. Room clean tea and coffee provided. If you are a light sleeper the trains may keep you awake. But after a busy day sight seeing you are tired.

Reviews.Title: “very good 3* hotel about 10min walk from sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: ayubdosani
Reviews.Content: right from the start, our stay at the almina was fantastic. from mehmet to ercin at the reception desk to the bell kid and the kitchen staff, everyone at the almina is helpful and easy to talk to. the location is pretty good, albeit a little 10min walk from the main sultanahmet square and it's tram stop. breakfast was simple, mostly breads/cheeses and dry meats as is the case with most in turkey. i'd recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking for a nice place in sultanahmet. p.s. remember to request a room away from the train line and also book directly with them for free transfers, ends up saving around Â£50!

Reviews.Title: “Almina Hotel Istanbul March 2012”
Reviews.Author: DPHorvath
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel offering bed and breakfast only. That said, it was clean with a good range of Turkish/continental breakfast and the room was clean and comfortable. The staff were all friendly and helpful. On arrival and check in, the manager sat down with us and gave us a street map, marking all the places we could go. We also got advice on where to change money and taking care around the city. The location of the hotel in Sultanhamet is very good for walking to all the main tourist attractions in the old part of town. The only downside is that there is a railway running at the back which is noisy when a train passes. That said we were only there in the evening and it did not keep us awake at night. Good, basic but friendly. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: skrilla Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Almina Hotel is in a perfect location for all your needs if visiting Istanbul. It shows you how to reach the hotel by train but if you find yourself infront of the Blue Mosque you are just a five minute walk away from your room. It is that close , but away from all the tourist hussle and bussle. There are pleny of restaurants and bars and shops right around the corner. Breakfast is plentiful. The staff is there for any needs you may have. As soon as we arrived we were teated like family and gave us all kinds of info about the area. Rooms are spacious and clean. 10 out of 10 for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the trains!”
Reviews.Author: Cangothere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days and on the whole found it very good value for money. We found that we could get freshly squeezed orange juice at breakfast if we asked the waiter which was wonderful. Also there is tea and a kettle, etc provided in the room but take coffee with you if you want it or, alternatively there are sachets available at the breakfast bar. We bought a small carton of milk in a nearby shop. Didn't sleep too well for the first 2 nights then I was so tired I did manage to block out the noise of the trains but the noise is a bit unfortunate as otherwise this would be an excellent hotel for visiting Istanbul. We also didn't do very well on our transfer from the airport as it was 10.30 in the evening and we couldn't find the correct bus and ended up over the bridge in Istanbul and had to pay for a taxi to take us to the hotel. Got the shuttle for our return flight and it only cost 23 Turkish Lira for two of us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: VijayRao
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is an excellent place to stay. We visited Istanbul with family and friends. The rooms are neat, clean and comfortable. Wifi is accessible from any place in the hotel and the speed is pretty good. Cordial and ever helpful hotel staff made our stay even more enjoyable. The gentleman at the reception was always available for help and guidance on places to see, visit along with details of various modes of transport to use to reach our destination. The hotel is ideally located and the tram station as well as the blue mosque is just a few minutes walk from the hotel. Great value for your money - Vijay

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: franzlf
Reviews.Content: We (me and my two kids) stayed in Almina Hotel during Christmas 2011. We had the Marmara family suite which wasnicely furnished and spacious with 2 single beds and 1 double. Dividing door, 2 tvs integrated in mirror and 2 minibars. Room is well maintained and well equipped, including free wifi. Sunrise can be enjoyed from the balcony and from roof terrace. Bathroom somewhat small but spotlessly clean and even had jacuzzi. Towels were changed daily. This hotel is truly a hidden treasure, because it is somewhat hard to find. But location could not be better. Ayasofya, blue mosque and other places are in walking distance of the hotel. Breakfast is plenty with a variety of food. From check-in till check-out, all hotel staff was always very friendly and helpful. Front desk employees are professional, fluently in English and always willing to help.As a woman, traveling with my two kids, I felt very safe in this hotel and its area. Certainly worth a recommendation to anyone planning to visit Istanbul. We will definetely come back to this excellent hotel and its friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: DeepinderK
Reviews.Content: A trip with friends, we booked a triple room for our stay. Being airline staff, and paying in cash, we got a decent 20% off the normal rates along with hotel transfers. On arriving, we were guided to a double room and given a spare bed (probably meant for kids). Imagine our disappointment! We contacted the reception, and demanded for the triple room we had paid for - matching the pictures on the website. The staff finally acknowledged that there had been an error at their end, and we could only get the triple room the next day. We managed that night, and were shifted to the triple room the next day. But this wouldnt have been possible if we didnt know that the room we were given was not what was advertised on the web. Free internet was a plus. Breakfast was average. The key is probably the location which is extremely close to the restaurants and the historical sights. Nightlife was a quick cab ride away. Overall an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: 279cecilie
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the weekend in Istanbul, and thats much because of the Almina hotel. First of all was the room great, clean and more than big enough for us. The location of the hotel was perfect for sightseeing, not far to any of the famous places. Ersin in the reception made us feel very welcome and was very helpfull with recomending places to see, shop and eat. He really gave us many tips we would have missed if he wasent soooooooo helpful. I recomend this hotel to anyone and i stay there for sure next time, i go back for sure Thank u Ersin for makeing our stay so great and keep on smileing =) Cecilie, Norway ps!!! dont miss the view from the rooftop terrace, its fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LesleyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Turkey and Istanbul. The Almina is situation in the heart of the old city and though not a first class hotel, we could have not asked for a better place to stay. Ersin the manager sat with us upon our arrival went though all the city highlights and suggested places and sites that we might like to visit. The view from the roof top was fantastic one way looking out over the Maramar sea the other back to the spires of the Blue Mosque. Our rooms although not big and maybe not the most modern were, clean, comfortable and the air conditioner worked. Breakfast was a traditional Turkish breakfast with lots of fresh food. Thanks Ersin we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the Almina to other travellers. Lesley, Melbourne, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable Service”
Reviews.Author: JustinLSU2
Reviews.Content: To start I was traveling with my wife and her sister so I was apprehensive about taking my first trip abroad and having to keep the two of them safe but have a great adventure. I had been communicating with Ersin of the Almina Hotel via email prior to our arrival,he had made arrangements for a driver to pick us up from the airport and special room requests. Upon arriving in Istanbul airport we were wisked away by our driver to the hotel and the amazing Ersin was there waiting, we were brought in out of the cold rain and he seated us and asked to have tea and a little chat. Ersin then sat and talked with us providing the what and what not to do while we were there and dealing with the locals. Ersin made us feel so at home in a land that was far from that. The free internet, breakfast and outsanding, courteous, and respectful staff that worked with Ersin made our trip so much more. I thank you Ersin and if I ever win the Lottery I would hope I could afford for you to run my hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lane j
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel that dosnt look like much from the outside but is 5STAR on the inside. close to everything, 5min walk to the Hypodrome & Blue Mosque, spacious clean rooms, wonderful bathroom facilities, excellent 24hr staff and FULL HUGE breakfast. was amazing value on lastminutes hotels.com kinda thing. sadly does back onto a train line, but if you can sleep with the windows closed they are sound proof and its not a problem. fully aircon.

Reviews.Title: “Almina Hotel Was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Gloria
Reviews.Content: The Almina was within walking distance to many of the old city tourist attractions and was small and quaint, our room (especially the bathroom), was clean and well maintained and the breakfast each morning was great. I enjoyed having access to a laptop with free Internet in the lobby so I could check in with family at the end of each day. My daughter enjoyed having a beer and taking in the view of the Blue Mosque and the Marmara sea from the rooftop. Best part of the hotel was the staff - they were so friendly and helpful. When we would come back from a long day, they would serve us tea and chat with us about our day. When we had an early morning flight and had to leave by 4 a.m., they even had tea and cake waiting for us in the lobby so we could have a bite to eat before we left. And yes, the trains are close by, but we were not bothered by the noise...we were too tired from our great excursions in a wonderful city! gloria, martha and alexandra

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful start to a wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: s z
Reviews.Content: From the time we booked this hotel online, Ersin and the staff at Almina hotel were very friendly and helpful in helping us plan our travels to Istanbul and beyond. They assisted in arranging transportation to and from the airport.(We stayed at Almina at the start of our trip and at the end after traveling to Antalya and Cappadocia). We arrived at the hotel late Saturday night and were greeted by an incredibly friendly Ersin and staff who took care of all of our luggage served us tea and sat with us and a map of the city giving us travel tips and routes. Ersin was very engaging and made us feel so welcome. He recommended a fabulous restaurant that was close by for a late dinner and also arranged to have us picked up and brought back to the hotel for our meal given the cold and rainy weather outside. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff was very polite and friendly. The breakfast was delicious and the accommodations both in the dining area and on the rooftop provide lovely views of the city and the sea. The location is fabulous for accessing most of the major sightseeing attractions in Istanbul and is also close by to the bus system for traveling to further regions. We had such a positive experience with Ersin and the staff at Almina that we arranged to stay there our last night in Istanbul as well before traveling home. Again the staff was waiting at 2 am with arms open to welcome us and help us into our rooms. Would highly recommend this hotel to others traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JHHinTurkey
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in the Sultanahmet area, close to all the touristy stuff, yet tucked away. (Some better/more detailed directions for guests would be nice.) The staff are amazingly helpful - which makes it a five star experience. They booked a dinner for us the first night - including transportation, then helped us order dinner in the following evening. We were staying with a group of friends, so it was nice to have breakfast together, taking in the beautiful scenery. There is a terrace on the roof that is probably amazing in better weather. Don't forget to have a cup of tea with the reception staff, it's the best I've ever had in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and cozy hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: TuranTalibova
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the center of Sultanahmet, 5-10 minutes walk to major sightseeing places and beautiful small restaurants. Very good choice in breakfast buffet which is served in the terrace which has a view to the sea. The staff is very friendly and helpful, rooms are very cozy and clean, ground floors have small gardens where you can drink tea or smoke. Also terrace has great view. I will definitely advice this great hotel to friends and family who are visiting Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: www88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Ramadan, so I got a good discounted price. A little away from the touristy parts of Sultanahmet, friendly staff, a great roof top terrace. Clean, spacious room, nice old building, free wireless, great breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: N B
Reviews.Content: We found the staff friendly, very helpful and efficient, the hotel was comfortable, with a sea view from the breakfast room, and breakfast had a good choice. Our standard room was comfortable and clean. Location is good for sight seeing. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A plaisant experience to begin again - I recommend it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: sisi_360
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, clean and modern and well placed. The staff is very competent, plaisant and attentive. Amazing experience that i recommend. Perfect accomodation if you look for the best location in the best place. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff + great view from roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: AngieAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Great location for all major sites - 10 mins walk to Blue Mosque + Topkapi Palace. Rooms are OK; good choice at buffet breakfast.; great view from roof terrace. Staff are extremely helpful in giving directions, booking taxis and recommending restaurants. The only negative is the train line which runs alongside the hotel. The noise is not so bad, it's the vibration that wakened me in the night + early morning so I recommend you book a room in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel, nice staff, can't wait for the next stay”
Reviews.Author: massilia87
Reviews.Content: We spent a whole week at the Almina otel! It was a wonderful stay! It is a lovely little hotel where the staff cares about you! Our room headed towards the street (and not to the railway) so the noise level was very low for us (we got awake by birds). Our room was clean and has a modern interior (the air conditioning works very well) The hotel has a nice terrace, the view was great, we could see the minaretts of the blue mosque and all the ships on the Marmara sea. The surroundings is perfect: short walking distance to all tourist 'must-sees', a lot of restaurants just 5 min away and we felt really safe during the night. The breakfast was really nice, 4 different kind of cheese, olives, nuts, some ham, different kind of eggs, fresh fruits, coffee, tea, juice and a variable choice of turkish sweets. Just at the arrival we were introduced into the city by the receptionist. The staff was always really nice and welcoming. They helped us in every situation such as finding a nice place to eat, how to get low prices at the bazar, the best time to visit the mosque or also when we had questions about the turkiish culture. At this place SPECIAL THANKS TO MEHMET, we enjoyed the really nice and interesting conversations we hope to c u soon again. Cheers ValÃ©rie and Adrian from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, friendly staff & amazing location... Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ISMAEL-DOHA
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location in the center of Sultan Ahmet, close to many attractions like Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. Close to Tram station with plenty of restaurants, mini-markets, dry clean, souvenir-shops, free car-park all nearby. Staff very friendly and helpful. Excellent breakfast buffet. Price was very cheap. Cons: Hotel is rather small, location is at a low area so you would have to access nearby places by ascending (a little tiring). Shower rather small (especially for fat people like me). But all of these are minor! Communication through e-mails was very good. I was offered free pickup from Airport and I had some special requests (no Alcohol in room) and it was attended to. I arrived on 1st of July 2011 and checked out on 5th of July 2011. Reception was very welcoming and offered plenty of help for locations, guides, maps and cost of transportation, food and many other items. If you keep asking, they keep answering with a nice smile. They really saved me and my wife plenty of efforts and costs. Adnan was very special and helpful in particular. Also, the receptionist on my last day (I don't remember his name) told us how to get to Sabiha airport for around 3.5 Euros per person (Tram-fairy boat-airport bus) instead of taking a 60 Euros taxi...! Thanks for the great tip...! Room was clean and with free fast internet service. Hot and cold water available 24/7. Shower was rather small, but I am quite fat too :) View outside not so much as hotel is surrounded by buildings, but breakfast lounge had a nice view. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Great Service, Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: LowBrow_Rambler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was lovely. The hotel is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque and other wonders to be seen but yet far enough away that the neighbourhood is relatively quiet and free of roaming drunkards. The staff was very helpful, easy going and seemed genuinely happy to assist and host us during our visit. The hotel is a bit small and I think that is what attributes to feeling that you matter to the staff. The roof terrace is lovely; I highly suggest you take your breakfast up there for the views in the morning. The hotel has air conditioning if you canâ€™t handle the heat. Great price for excellent accomodations. One warning note - if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room on the side that does not face the railroad tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, decent location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: mdgirl76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights this May. I was well aware of the loud trains but since we were out most of the day, it wasn't a big deal. It does get quite loud though, so if you are a light sleeper, don't stay here. The rooms are small, especially the bathroom (not enough room for 2 ppl at once), but they are clean and well decorated. The hotel stay includes a typical Turkish breakfast. Decent spread that left us satisfied. Overall, the hotel itself was fine. The customer service is a different story and is the reason for my poor rating. Upon booking the hotel, I requested a room as far from the train as possible and got a response that they would accomodate. When we got there, only two rooms were available: street level right next to the train, or basement level with only a teeny tiny window (think dungeon) also next to the train. Obviously my request was NOT considered. The other options were the family sized rooms costing more that twice what I paid for the standard room. So, we chose the street level. Ok, fine, we can live with it. Upon arrival, the manager (owner?), gave us a very friendly (fake) greeting. After getting settled in he offered us tea and explained in depth all the excursions (very expensive) we could book through the hotel. For example, Bosphorus cruise: do it yourself using the public ferry at 25TL/person, or go through the hotel for 80EU/person. The difference? Large ferry, lunch on your own vs. more private charter, lunch provided. All other excursions were equally overpriced, especially for budget travellers like us. We were interested in a day trip to Ephesus. We calculated that we could book a private tour ourselves for much less than the group tour arranged by the hotel, so we did. We arranged the airport transfers through the hotel, also expensive but we just went with it for convenience sake. All was fine until I noticed the driver was going to the wrong airport. When I alerted the driver, he said he was told the wrong airport by the hotel receptionist. The driver felt genuinely terrible and did what he could to get us to the corrrect airport on time. He was an awesome driver. Luckily we made it to the airport, but we came very close to missing our flight. When we returned to the hotel that evening, we did not get a single apology, or even an acknowledgement fromt the hotel staff regarding their error. When I told the manager about it the next day, he blew me off and responded with a "yes, yes, I already heard the whole story." Again, NO apology and I was made to feel like an inconvenience. Horrible customer service. Bottom line, once the manager realized he wasn't going to make any more money off of us through the excursions, there was a complete attitude shift. I will say that the bell hops and cleaning lady were all very nice. It's the management that stinks. We overheard other guests thank the manager for a fruit basket gift. A few minutes later we also heard them thank him for the excursion arrangements. Hmm...

Reviews.Title: “The trains outside run on time!”
Reviews.Author: afrocentric
Reviews.Content: You have all read the glowing reviews about this friendly, comfortable, excellently located little hotel in Old Sultanahmet - but do be prepared for the earthshaking trains passing on the adjacent tracks between 06:00 - 23:00. Light /late sleepers or those looking for a chilled venue might do best looking elsewhere . . .

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money, dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: AYasin3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not as described, all the rooms were very small and shabby in need of some repair , it was generally disappointing. On the plus side I found the staff polite, although comparing it to my last two trips to Istanbul the hotel fell very short. The breakfast was also disappointing. I had travelled alone and was planning to meet friends out in Istanbul and had asked if the hotel would allow one of my friends to stay with me and they agreed at a cost of 30 Euros per night. When I arrived they declined that this arrangement had been made and then finally agreed on 40 Euros per night. When my friend arrived we agreed that this was a bit steep and decided that we wouldn't continue with the arrangement but that I would stay alone. The hotel still charged me for one night despite the fact that my friend didn't stay or have breakfast and only spent about 2 hours with me in the room before heading out for dinner, no luggage was even brought over. They insisted that since the person had entered the room I would be charged, even though there was no check -in and no key was given. I was surprised with their lack of understanding or flexibility. I would definitely give the hotel a miss for many reasons; including all of the above and the fact that it is right by the train track and despite being in one of the back streets it is a very noisy location.

Reviews.Title: “Well rounded place to crash!”
Reviews.Author: DualFishy
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, good location. A little noisy with the train line and a limited breakfast however. The rooms were very clean but small. If you are trying to find this place from the tram stop (Sultanahmet), you will probably need a map. It is close but a little bit of a maze. Also don't try to catch the train and tram from the airport of you have heavy luggage as there are many stairs to navigate on the way when you change between the two.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, good location, too much noise”
Reviews.Author: eja_2011
Reviews.Content: We spent the better part of February looking at hotels in Istanbul. Almina hotel attracted our attention due to its positive reviews and location-Sultanahmet-where Agia Sofia, Blue mosque and all sorts of traditional shops and restaurants can be found. The location of the hotel is indeed great, literally 15min from the main sights and in a relatively good position for taxis (crucial in moving around the city!). The staff are also exceptionally friendly, welcoming and keen to assist anyway they can. Thats however where the positive points end. The hotel, like almost all in that area, is an old house, transformed into a hotel. This means there is literally no soundproofing-from tv's to bathrooms all can be heard! Its greatest problem though is the external noise. The hotel is situated on top of train tracks (btw nowhere do they mention that), which means that everytime the train comes through, the entire building shakes but above all the noise can be defeaning. And the train does go through ALOT! To top it all, this tiny street (that is otherwise unknown to taxi drivers) seems to attract tones of cars and passer-by day and night-especially night!again, despite double windows, one can listen not just the cars coming through bumping along the thick rocks which make up the 'street' but the conversations of the tourists and locals at all times of day and night! In general we were not satisfied. So if someone is not bothered by noise, then go ahead and pick it, because it has the advantage of its staff and location. But if noise is an issue for you, as it was for us, be ready for sleepless nights...and look for alternative accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jleon3
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at The Almina hotel!!! The staff was super friendly and very welcoming, especially Ersin :) Dring our stay he took the time to help us plan each of our days and gave us great suggestions on places to see and delicious restaurants. The hotel location is central to many local tourist sights within walking distance; it is a safe, quiet area. However, I would like to make a small suggestion...if you're a light sleeper as I am...I would bring a pair of ear plugs...there's a train that runs though the area during certain hours I think from like 6am-11pm (don't quote me). Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel. They also have a great breakfast buffet daily, food was always fresh and tasty!! I know I will definitely revisit not only Istanbul but this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manou1909
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Istanbul and love it very much. Almina hotel is a nice and calm place to be. It's located in Sultanahmet near to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and had a great staff, very helpful... Thank you Ersin for your help to find our way and for all the teas we get each time we gt back to the hotel after a long day :) I will definitely go back there :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ckristien7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very nice,clean, beds very comfortable, the breakfast was very good. The view from terrace was so beautiful. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. Its a great location close to everything were you will be able to walk to. I do recommend the hotel it was very nice, comfortable, cozy and friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, pleasant and near to blue mosque & main attractions”
Reviews.Author: zia_11
Reviews.Content: We got tranferred to this hotel by Antis hotel because they over booked. We got a delux room pleasantly decorated and very clean. the porter was very helpful. my wife is a light sleeper so she was disturbed at around 7:30 in the morning as the train whizzed by, other then that I can't really fault it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place near some the great attractions of Istanbul,if a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Jalp123
Reviews.Content: Great place, good value. Slight problem with a train coming by every so often. I think it is better to ask for a room facing away from the tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and rooms, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: Jacob-malik786
Reviews.Content: My partner and i are currently on our fourth night here and have one more night to go... It's a nice little hotel just a few minutes away from the main tourist attractions. The rooms are of good size with a small but adequate sized en-suite. We were extremely disappointed with the minimal variety at breakfast, we never thought we'd be given orange squash instead of fresh juice at a four star hotel! The rooms are lovely however the cleaners do seem to do the least they can. Only the beds are made and the rest is left for me and my pregnant wife to tidy up! Also be warned there are no English tv channels. Overall if you are looking for a value for money THREE star hotel, this would be it but I wouldn't give it a four star rating is establishes itself on!

Reviews.Title: “Classy inexpensive little hotel near tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Yitzchuk1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel at one third the cost of comparable hotels. Efficent manager, friendly staff. Clean, large rooms. Fine buffet breakfast. A couple of blocks from Blue Mosque and main tourist attractions. Located in typical winding streets of old city, with all its atmosphere. When I told mgr I didn't want to wander around at night, he called a car which deposited me at a fine Turkish restaurant (for free). A gorgeous tourist oriented restaurant is 220 yards away. What's the catch? Why is this such an unbelievable bargain? Because, every once in a while, the muted sounds of trains whisper by for a few seconds. Less frequently at night. I am a light sleeper and was unaware of them. Best bargain in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price. Loved the buffet breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Seetheworld025
Reviews.Content: The top deck provides a great view of the water. Great place for a sunrise. A five minute walk brings you to the tram that runs down the center of Istanbul And even goes all the way to Ataturk airport if you want to save a couple bucks on the cab. The staff was beyond helpful and pleasant. The hotel was clean and the breakfast buffet should easily get you to dinner. The location is quiet at night yet still close to Bars and restaraunts. Laundry right up the road if you need to have cleaning done. Lots of old building add to the charm

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at Almina Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UCLMSatchel
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel. The service was very good - Cemil was very helpful. Rooms were clean and the breakfast buffet was good. No complaints whatsoever in terms of service - but I would suggest doing a good review of restaurants before taking their recommendations. Took 2 of their recommendations and did better when we chose our own restaurants based on online reviews. Location is excellent, right in the old city. Its walking distance from some of the major attractions - blue mosque, topkapi, etc. Sleep quality was a touch compromised as there is a railway line on one side of the building and our room faced the line. Istanbul is very walkable - if you have more than a couple of days walk your way around the city. The sea buses are excellent for transportation to the asia side and to get a good view of the bhosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “Simple the Best”
Reviews.Author: papaki_mou
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in a beautiful neighborhood, near to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia! Clean rooms and charming decoration. Very heplfull and kind stuff! Total suggested!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, we love it.”
Reviews.Author: Nargis1981
Reviews.Content: Love it very much...Nice and calm place to be... We spent a great time here. Great staff, very helpful... We will definitely back and stay in Almina hotel during our spring visit... we are strongly recommending it...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel”
Reviews.Author: rimute1
Reviews.Content: Planning our trip to Istanbul we chose Almina hotel acording to Trip Advisor reviews... and we were more than pleased with our decision. Almina is a wonderful hotel with excellent location and exceptionally pleasant statf. Surely Almina will be our hotel on the next trip to Istanbul. Thanks to Almina's personal and good luck to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: dedkede
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time here, the staff were so friendly and professional.The room was very comfortable and the location of the hotel is very good and close to everything.We would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Admirable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jurbui
Reviews.Content: Itâ€˜s a lovely, small hotel with great location (all main sightseeing attractions are nearby) and exceptional service. The hotel was clean and cozy. The staff were helpful, friendly and smiling all the time. Everyone and everything made us feel special. We are planning another trip to Istanbul in spring and definitely Almina will be our place of stay again. Good luck to everyone and special thanks to Ersin for warm welcome. Best regards

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mayu0706
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night at almina hotel. Including cleaning ladies staff there are very kind and friendly. Hotel itself is relly clean comfortable. The guy at information counter I think his name is Cemil is a really proffesional hotel man.i stayed there veruy comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Still excellent the second time around”
Reviews.Author: Izzy7544
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Almina, and I am pleased to note that the hotel is as good as I remembered and experienced the last time - in terms of service, cleanliness and atmosphere. The ever resourceful & helpful Cemil is still there, but there has been some changes to the members of staff : however, they're equally friendly, curteous and professional. As a returning customer, it did feel a bit like coming home, which is a nice feeling to have when you're abroad. Well done to the Almina team for maintaining the excellent standard in service! and thank you for making it yet another memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderVH
Reviews.Content: I had a 4-night stay in the Almina Hotel and I loved it. The location is great, the breakfast included was delicious and the service at the reception was outstanding. Thanks for the great stay, Almina!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel--super!)))”
Reviews.Author: KATOSH
Reviews.Content: Located close to attractions. There are many 3-star hotels in Sultanahmet, but this hotel is new, with new rooms, bathroom fixtures, and the plasma in the room, which is not typical for hotels of 3 stars. I was pleasantly surprised, because I live in Sultanahmet is not the first time. There is even a Turkish bath, professional massage therapists. You can have breakfast in the restaurant on the 4 floor with a magnificent view of the city. The hotel is very friendly and welcoming staff, always ready to help you and suggest any question. Also the hotel has pleased its price. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exelent hotel in the best place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EvgeniyaV
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, recommend to young people , who want to live with nice service and in more convinient place. All sight seeings are near. All touristic place very close to the hotel. In the hotel: clean rooms, new furniture, nice equipted. Thanks to the hotel for nice time!!!

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bianca_Gent_Belgium
Reviews.Content: Just back from vacation. We had a lovely holiday, stayed for 6 days. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. The hotel is centrally located, everything is nearby. We recommend to use the Welness facilities! We would come back when we return to Istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mahserjiana
Reviews.Content: My visit to Istanbul woudn't have been the same if I hadn't stayed at the Almina Hotel. Almina was extremely clean, had excellent service, and was in a great location. It was easy to get around not only because the location was prime, but also because the staff was so helpful. The only downfall I experianced was the staffs' recommendations for restaurants. If you want to go to a place where locals go, then make sure that you don't go to the restaurants recommended by the hotel. The restaurants that were recommended to us were very nice, and the quality of food was excellent, however, they were tourist spots and didn't encompass the true authenticity of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “un hotel tres maqnifiue”
Reviews.Author: samuelselcuk
Reviews.Content: this hotel so clean and the stafff so much kind of and smiller .... also breakfast many varietes and tradionational turkish breakfast ...... thanks a lot for this hotel .,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Just Stay For Yourself and See”
Reviews.Author: Fujiman50
Reviews.Content: As a Travel Photographer, I have stayed at Hotels in many parts of the World, and I can tell you that the Almina Hotel is fine. It has to be - competition in the Sultanahmet district is fierce. All the staff, particularly the guys on Reception, are very professional and friendly, offering advice to the 1st time visitor to Istanbul. And those free drinks of Tea or Coffee, at any time, are most welcome, especially after long days out sightseeing ! As mentioned by others, you do hear the train occasionally, and the early morning call to prayer, but don't let these things stop you from staying here. Hope to see you next year ! Steve www.steveoutram.com

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATÄ°ON AND BEST STAFF”
Reviews.Author: chris_2144
Reviews.Content: Location is wonderful.Tram station is just only a 10 minute by walking ,the Blue Mosque, TopkapÄ± Palace, Hagia Sophia. We arrived early time and the staff allowed us to check into our room which was super normally check in time is at 12 and lots of hotels charge extra for this but they didnâ€™t charge. Breakfast served in roof top restaurant between 7.30 and 10.30am with great open buffet.Also you can have diner in the restaurant.The staff were helpful. Room and hotel were clean, decor is very good. The room was big and comfortable , mini fridge had everything you need including.There was a, free WIFI or use of a computer if you donâ€™t have your own. We will come back to Istanbul and weâ€™ll be stay in this hotel again. You sould get information from Nesrin, she is very knowled and pretty

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: batgrl
Reviews.Content: The Almina hotel is in a great location in Sultanahmet. It is very clean...hammam and massage area peaceful...delicious breakfast and beautiful views of the Marmara Sea and Blue Mosque from the terrace. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Cemil and Ahmet were very accommodating. I have stayed in different hotels in this area, but Almina is definitely the best!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: larjuan
Reviews.Content: We hunted around Sultanahmet and were really happy to find the Almina. Staff were personable & helpful. Location is great, rooftop is spectacular and breakfast is delicious. Rooms are smallish but comfortable and very pleasant. The only knock is the noise level - trains run on one side and taxis on the other even though it's a side street. The 5 AM call to prayer is loud.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!!!”
Reviews.Author: jovit250680
Reviews.Content: The hotel made you feel like you are staying at a friend's place rather than a hotel. The staff are very friendly, right from the staff at the reception - Cemil, Ersin and Adnan, to the catering staff, to the housekeeping staff as well! You are greeted warmly, attended to promptly and serviced well. The location was also a very good one, though some of the cabbies had a little confusion, but to overcome that, we are given a business card of the hotel with the location map, so this made it easier for the cabbies to take us to the right place! The food served at the restaurant was super-delicious! Definitely the place for foodies!! The best thing here was also the warm way in which we are catered to! The staff, I unfortunnately don't remember their names, keep checking on you to see if there is anything you would require! The ambience of the lobby is a very calm one, and the best thing is you would never feel bored! The staff would make sure they would strike a conversation with you and keep your company till the tour buses or cab picked us up. The hamam, sauna, etc. are also very neat and clean. Prices for the packages on offer are very reasonable. Our room was, according to me, the best one in the hotel! We were just above the entrance, and can proudly show our friends the room!! The plants on the window sill, the windows, etc. would make you feel like you are in your own home! The room is serviced well everyday, and the best thing is the linen smells so fresh! We are provided with extra linen as well, and this is placed in the cupboard in the room. The only issue we faced was that the double room we booked for my wife and me had two single beds joined together... which does not make for comfortable sleeping, but, otherwise, everything about the room was perfect! I, in fact, did make a mention of this during one of my chats with the reception staff, and hope they make changes to the bed type in the room. All in all, my wife and I really felt like this was the hotel to be in for our trip to Istanbul. Everything was perfect right from the booking phase till the drop off at the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “amazin hotel and the best customer service”
Reviews.Author: darknite86
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Almina Hotel in Sultanahmet with my friends for 6 days. I was impressed with the following: 1- Very friendly staff that I felt that they were like friends. 2- Their staff members made excellent recommendations for me for restaurants and places . 2- Cleanliness. The hotel is pretty new and clean 3- Great deal...Staying in Sultanahmet can get pricey specially in the summer, but I found Almina's price to be competitive in terms of what I was getting. 4- Customer Service - is amazing .. starting with ersin .. cemil ..adnan and their other staffss..fully imformative about the location and gave us the best deals on packages. 5- Breakfast is amazing , gulzar and other staffs were really helpful when

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: rachfoxy
Reviews.Content: the service at the hotel was excellent, the cleaniliness of all areas was second to none & all staff were really polite & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesum Guys. Very great stay and service.”
Reviews.Author: byrney
Reviews.Content: Istanbul has become one of my favourite cities anywhere. And if it wasnt for the service and rooms at the Almina my impression would be very different. The whole stay was an absolute pleasure. i would not hesitate recommending it to anyone. And jimmy your a champion. Woooo

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel in Sultanhamet area w/ awesome roof deck!”
Reviews.Author: buzdum12
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 days in June and it was absolutely divine. The location was awesome. The service was so friendly and hospitable! Especially Cemil "jamie" he goes by (he works the front desk). He is adorable and very helpful when offerring up suggestions of the best attractions to see while in Turkey! They have this beautiful deck that you can see the Blue Mosque from, very pretty view! All in all, I would give it an A+.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff at a great deal”
Reviews.Author: haniakil
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Almina Hotel in Sultanahmet for 13 days. I was impressed with the following: 1- Very friendly staff that I felt that they were like friends. Although I've been to Istanbul several times in my life and thought that I'm pretty familiar with it, their staff members made excellent recommendations for me for restaurants and places that I hadn't visited before. 2- Cleanliness. The hotel is pretty new and clean 3- Great deal...Staying in Sultanahmet can get pricey specially in the summer, but I found Almina's price to be competitive in terms of what I was getting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with super friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Reiser52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet residential area among the winding cobblestone streets of the Sultanahmed district. Recently renovated, the hotel has modern amenities and even a Turkish bath. We were impressed by the helpfulness and local knowledge of the staff. We really appreciated the personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: SyedNazir
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in Almina Hotel. We enjoyed the wonderful hospitality of the hotel staff, comfortable rooms, excellent service and the close proximity to the main attractions in Istanbul. All the front desk staff namely Cemil, Nesrin and Benham were very knowledgeable, helpful and fun to talk to. We will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a memorable stay in Istanbul. Cheers Syed ( Singapore)

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly Hotel with great hospitality and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Marchulsebos
Reviews.Content: We have been for a week in Almina in March for our anniversary. The hotel is closely locatede to Sutanamet moskee and every thing else. The lokation is peacefull and eventhough next to a train rail, it is a lot better then the noisy other hotels with a lot of night life activity. Besides the train rides only from 06.00 till 22.00. It fdidn't disturb us a bit. The staff is very nive an d supportive, nothing is to much, they go to extreem lengths in order to make your stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Izzy7544
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almina in May 2010. Bookings were made through a local travel agent -Walkabout Tours. We were a bit apprehensive at first â€“ though the hotel looked good on its website, we canâ€™t be too sure (and Iâ€™ve travelled enough to know that sometimes what is depicted may not necessarily be what really is). But we took some comfort in the positive reviews found on Tripadvisor. My momâ€™s reaction as we approached the hotel (having navigated through small roads and back lanes â€“ on this, I must really applaud the skills of Turkish drivers!) was â€œWe are not staying here, are we?â€�. However, her apprehension was doused as we stepped into the lobby of the hotel. It was tastefully decorated, clean and orderly and the gentleman manning the front-desk, Cemil Sahin, was very professional yet friendly and welcoming. Checking-in was a breeze. Our double room was on the same level as the lobby and over looked the street. Although it was small, it had all the mod-con you need, including 24hrs free wi-fi. Furnishing was smart/practical, simple with clean lines, without unnecessary flares & flounces that would make a small room feel even more compact. Bathroom was modern and again a bit on the small side. Notwithstanding, the room met our basic needs as this was not the type of holiday where weâ€™d be lounging around the hotel. The most important point â€“ the room was very clean, tidy & well maintained. And the bed, is very, very comfortable. Breakfast was a buffet of bread, cereals, cold cuts, cheese, fruits, a variety of compotes, cookies, cakes and eggs in 2 styles â€“ boiled and scrambled. They provide an array of choices for tea and juices. In short, a nice satisfying tuck in the morning. You can even have your breakfast up on the roof terrace, with views of the water and the beautiful Sultan Ahmet Mosque. The terrace is also nice in the evenings to chill and relax under the open sky, after a full day of touring the beautiful, amazing city that is Istanbul. In short, we had a satisfying stay at Almina â€“ room sizes aside and the occasional roar of the train passing by â€“ thereâ€™s little fault you can find with the hotel and the facilities provided, or with the impeccable, efficient, professional, helpful and friendly staff who made our stay even more pleasant and memorable. We didnâ€™t quite get all the names of the staff but those we did (Nasrin, Cemil & Ali), weâ€™ll remember.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lola981
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by Cemil, who was so friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Location is great, 5 minute walk from most major attractions (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, etc.), I would stay there again and recommend it to friends traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Up on the roof”
Reviews.Author: simplicityLondon
Reviews.Content: It's a gem, small and shiny in a great setting. So much to see and do nearby it offers a great place to re-charge your batteries before heading out for another slice of all that Istanbul has to offer. The staff are charming, well-informed and helpful. The hammam in the basement is a bonus and the terrace bar on the roof is a treat. An especially good choice for railway enthuaiasts

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nicer staff!”
Reviews.Author: Anil58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as I was visiting Istanbul on work. The hotel is very comfortable and very well furnished. Located in Sultanahment close to all the attractions yet very convenient to take a tram and get around. Fantastic breakfast and nice view from the terrace. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. In particular, I must mention Cemil who was very, very nice and went out of his way to suggest suitable things to do. He was very kind, we became good friends and he showed me the "real" Istanbul, taking me to places where the Turkish youth hang out! We even smoked a water pipe and watched a football match and visited a market to buy figs and apricots. I would recommend this hotel to anybody and don't forget to ask for Cemil!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff that go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Little noisy, but that is the joy of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Simply_Traval
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location - in Sultanahmet, close to the main attractions, but just far enough away to make you feel you are not totally in tourist-ville! The staff were extremely friendly, and very keen to make us feel at home, and welcome us to Istanbul. They were attentive without being over the top, and friendly without being over familiar. Rooms are fine, nothing particularly special. Basic and comfortable, cleaned with extraordinary efficiency every morning. Breakfast is very well stocked buffet with something to suit all tastes. Only down side was the noise. In Istanbul you cannot really escape the noise of the street which is a hubbub of activity at all hours of the day and night. And is one of the main attractions! However, the hotel is next to a railway line, and this of course adds to the noise effect. If you're a light sleeper take some ear plugs and you'll be fine! Overall I think this hotel is a great option for a long weekend. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: MarcusMacao
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel with very friendly staff. Rooms are very comfortable, although the bathroom is a bit small. Buffet brreakfast is good. Its location next to the train line is a bit of downturn, though. Over all, a very nice stay, also because Istambul is an amazing city. Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff - good price - ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: Muni_Kadi
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with welcoming staff, and very friendly atmosphere...The breakfast on the roof gives you a wonderful scene of the Bogaz and Sultan Ahmet...with good variety of food. They also have a night bar in the roof at night time... They do have an operation turkish Hammam for your convenience without the need to go to a Hammam somewhere else, the historical sites and Arazta Bazar are 5-10 minutes walk away... The rooms are well furnished and sunny...the only thing that you might feel bothered with is the train track next to it...ask for the rooms on the otherside which are more convinient in this regard...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katie087
Reviews.Content: Almina hotel is a nice place to stay and beautifully situated. The rooms are clean and tidy.The staff is very friendly and helpful. Al in all a nice place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: vongonono
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay in Istanbul at the Almina Hotel. Very good situation for visitors near the blue mosquÃ©e, the Marmara Sea and a nice typical shopping area (see pictures). Very welcoming staff with lots of good advise. Nice terrace on the roof. Breakfast was delicious. Only negative thing is the proximity of the train but we get used to it after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monecay7
Reviews.Content: We walked past this hotel shortly after having checked into our hostel in the Sultanamet and wished we had seen this place first before we committed to the other place. What made this hotel stand out was the attention to detail in the rooms to ensure the quality of comfort was an "experience" in the best possible way. The interior layout and design of the rooms were hi-tech, sleek and state of the art and still affordable and kept very clean, and well maintained. Overall the ambience of the hotel felt welcoming, secure, the reception staff in particular a gentleman called Cemil were very courteous, helpful and provided information about shows or tours when asked, but did not do any high pressure sales pitch for one or the other like some places do. On our return trip to we will be staying at the Almina Hotel, and recommend it to all our friends coming over for the special celebrations for the 2010 European City of Culture. Best Moneca Yardley

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: scotvic
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Almina as we were stranded in Istanbul during the air travel disruptions due to volcanic ash. It was a good solution for us as it was nearby, cheap (for the area) and they had availability. We ended up with a 'garden room' (lower ground floor) opening on to a tiny garden area but right next to the railway line. Upper floor rooms seemed better (but also dearer). Good things about it - conveniant locality, comfortable bed, fairly spacious room, clean, good bathroom, and all mod cons, good breakfast. Staff were obliging and pleasant. There is a small sauna and turkish bath (we didn't try these). Bad things about it - noise from railway and power generator (had to wear earplugs in order to sleep). If you go there, try to get a room on the street side not the railway side,The street is slightly out of the way and a bit down at heel (though safe) . Worst for us was hotel staff inefficiency (or poor communication between desk staff, and/or lack of mastery of computer booking system?) that led to confusion over what had been booked and at what rate - staff member even tried to get into our room one night as we slept because they'd misrecorded our check-in. (NB No safety chain on door.) I'd say this is an OK hotel - just - but you could do much better - there are literally hundreds of small hotels around the SultanAhmet area and almost all would be just as conveniantly located and more pleasant overall. Finally, unless you are on a really tight budget (in which case a two star or hostel might suit better) be careful of what the Almina calls an 'Economy room' as these are virtually underground with no window.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but you can do better...expensive, poor food, ANTS!”
Reviews.Author: NoStoppinUs
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 night stay in room 104, a Garden Family Room with a double bed and two singles in a partially separate space costing 200euro/night on a holiday weekend. If you want a room that will allow you to comfortably share with your kids (very hard to find in Europe), then this room meets that need (it even has a small bathtub AND you get access to a nice, enclosed garden where the kids can play). That's really the only plus of this hotel. Not to say it's a bad hotel, it's not. The staff tries hard. The decor is mostly modern - Scandinavian looking furniture mixed with plush velvet and brocade fabrics. But they keep missing the mark. For example, after the room, the next most important thing to me is breakfast. It was BORING, of low quality and lacking in variety. Except for Friday, the bread was almost tasteless! Buy similiar bread from a bakery off the tourist track and you'll discover just how good it should taste. Next issue, inadequate problem resolution. On our first night, the kids discovered ants in their beds - gross! Well, it's a garden room, in Spring, so I can see how this might happen. We asked them to take care of it. Next day, it was no better. We complained again. No improvement. Complained again. Finally, they must have done something because it was much better. (FYI, we didn't request another room because it was Easter weekend and everywhere was booked solid!) Another issue we had with the room was the incredibly slow shower drain. If you took too long, you risked overflowing the small tub. We alerted them to the issue every day. By day 3, we saw a slight improvement but it was never resolved. I could go on listing lots of little things they got wrong, but I think I've made my point - don't stay here unless you really, really need this type of hard to find room.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Sultanahmet; reasonably priced; friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: cimabi
Reviews.Content: I was involved in securing the Almina Hotel in Sultanahmet for three groups of travelers in January and February 2010. The first group were two couples from Poland, and Norway, living in Prague, visiting Istanbul for leisure and business. The second was a couple living in Vermont, USA, visiting me, and Istanbul for leisure. The third group was a couple from Maine, USA visiting me, and Istanbul for leisure. All three groups were happy with their stay at Almina. The Almina is one of the newest hotels in this area; clean and shiny; large lobby for reading, tea, gathering. ~The staff is very friendly and helpful. ~The breakfast is extensive and more than ample. ~The rooms are clean, bright and adequate. ~Rooftop terrace with views of Marmara Sea and Sultanahmet Mosque. ~The Almina is located within walking distance to all the cultural sites in Sultahanmet. ~Safe neighborhood, as is all of Istanbul, in fact. ~Nearby restaurants, shops etc. ~The front door is always manned after hours. ~I do not hesitate to recommend the Almina to anyone. Note: a rail-line passes below Sultahnamet, and although the traffic is not at all heavy, all the hotels in this area have some occasional background rail traffic. Hotels further up the hill towards Sultanahmet Square however, will have much heavier city noise. Istanbul is a beautiful, wonderfully busy, exciting, friendly, safe city. You can't go wrong staying at the Almina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pakborn
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Almina Hotel, the location was very good and peaceful, the staf very friendly. Not to forget Jameel, Nasrin and Ali, who were always helpful and caring. Hotel had all the facilities; Wi-Fi in the room, Heater (we went in March, it was cold there), shower etc. To top it all the hotel is always welcoming in guests and provides very good competitive rates and accepts the offers of rates from its guests. The breakfast was good, the hotel was very clean. JUst one downside (not to complain from a boutique hotel) the room and bathroom size was just on the smaller size, but that was fine by any standard for a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is in the near from the City and itÂ´s very clean in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: zuemruet
Reviews.Content: The Personal from the Hotel are very friendly und helps us with every problems

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the whole of Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: starhenna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good. We all went as a family and children came too. The hotel was quiet which was nice but i think with us in it, it was'nt quiet with kids running everywhere. All the staff were very nice especially to the kids they were vey patient. Even though it is a small hotel its just like home cosy and comfortable. All the Attractions like Blue Mosque and Hagia Sapphire were all just walking distance. Also the hotel do good packages if you want to go to different places around the area they can book a mini bus for you. The rooms were clean and the cleaners were great too, if you asked them to vacume your room they would do it as soon as possible. All the staff were very friendly !

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant time”
Reviews.Author: alminaprincess
Reviews.Content: Almina Hotel is either new or refurbished to lovely standards, all crisp and clean. Very close to the main attractions of Istanbul, definitely recommended if you do not have much time in the city as you can walk to Blue Mosque in 5 minutes, Aya Sofya and the Cisterns in 10 and baths and market are about 15 min away! All so close. Above all the staff is genuinely friendly and helpful every single minute. And they have baths in the basement!!!!!!! As I said, I had the most pleasant time there.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel and greeted by most friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: crawley786
Reviews.Content: we picked it this hotel mainly for it's location as its located in the heart of istanbul (sultanahmet) which is literally walking distance from all the main cultural places and market places like the grand bazaar and blue mosque. we had read some bad reviews with the taxi drivers so we decided to take airport transfers which cost us 105 liras approx (50) euros. our driver picked us up from the sabiha Gokcen International Airport and took us a little over an hour due to heavy traffic. on the way back we decided taxi was cheaper and had found a driver who took us for 70 liras and took about 40 minutes. our stay in the almina hotel was 3 nights.. on arrival we were greeted by cemil , ali and the glamorous Nesrin. we found them incredibly friendly and always helpful. cemil had given us anything we needed such as umberellas as it rained on our first evening and also a travel adaptor. night staff were also very friendly and always let us relax in the reception and use internet etc. only down side to the hotel was the sauna facility.. it's a separate health club and you will need to pay extra to use this and also give a 3 hour notice which we found ridicaulous. please don't use the hotel trutkish bath as it's not a proper turkish bath. hotel staff did try and sell us the turkish bath but we wen't to one nearby which is approximately 5-10 minutes and had a fantastic experience. the breakfast in the morning was excellent and the rooms were clean and tidy. the hotel staff were excellent and trustworthy. one of us had left his camera on the breakfast lounge and the house-keeper handed it over. hotel is situated next to a railway track but you hardl hear it and not may trains run at night. plenty of places to eat close by and tram service is also walkig distance. for entertainment in the evening we headed out to taxim by tram and got a taxi back which was about 15 lira. overall i would recommend this hotel as its ideal location and the staff speak good english and will always go out their way yo help you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Renee S
Reviews.Content: I found Almina to be above adequate for our needs when staying in Istanbul. We were greeted with a smile and sincere inquiries to our needs by staff. I am a very light sleeper, but somehow I slept like a dream here even though it is fairly close to the route of the tram... Within minutes of placing my head on the pillow I was out - I wish this were true at home. Some of that could be attributed to active daily schedules in the city, but it was surprising to me nonetheless. The breakfast was always a fulfilling start to the day, and coming back after a long day always felt comfortable as if I were at home. The rooms were cozy, clean, and aesthetically pleasing. The location was nice because it is not in a major district with traffic. I would recommend walking past the immediate area for shopping because it is a little touristy and high priced. Also, the restaurants nearby cannot serve alcohol due to the proximity to the Blue Mosque. It is a very short walk to everything (this coming from an American point of view:) I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: katylouiseLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almina Hotel for 5 nights and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were clean and furnished to a high standard. The buffet breakfast each morning was fantastic and filled us up for the whole day! All the staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The hotel is also ideally located for seeing all the major attractions. I was initially concerned that there would noise given that the hotel is located right next to the train line, but since the trains do not run at night, this was not a problem for us. The hotel also has a small spa/hammam, which although we chose not to use, looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jedininja
Reviews.Content: I know it may sound hard to believe, but wow, this place was perfect. I felt that the staff was part of my family. Iâ€™m still in contact with some of them today. The food was delicious and the view from the roof is breathtaking. I really canâ€™t think of anything I didnâ€™t like about my stay at Almina Hotelâ€¦ except for the train. But those stop running around 10pm so it never interfered with my sleep. Long story short, Almina hotel was the perfect hotel, in a perfect location, in a perfect city.

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 Hotel In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HaggiLondon
Reviews.Content: I believe this to be the best hotel in all of Istanbul. The staff are really welcoming and friendly, and there looked after us brilliantly throughout our stay. There even went out of there way various times to ensure we enjoyed our stay to the maximum. The room felt like a 7 star hotel, nice and luxurious, and was cleaned and set everyday. The hotel is in a prime location and is in walking distance to all the local attractions. Blue mosque is around the corner to the hotel. We were treated like family by the hotel staff, I would like to say a big thank you to the following staff members of the Almina hotel whom we have become very good friends with: Nesrin, Aziz, Zeynep and last but not least Cemil for providing us with excellent service and making our stay in Istanbul a really enjoyable one. I would most definitely recommend anyone to book with this hotel and can guarantee that you will have a memorable stay and will enjoy every second.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, location, and lots to do 10/10”
Reviews.Author: srashid
Reviews.Content: Hotel alminah is a great place to stay, the staff deliver high quality customer service, the rooms are well maintained and the sauna and steam room is fantastic. The breakfast buffet was also great with a range of food to eat. the hotel is also located close to historic sites in istanbul and is very convenient to travel to places like the grand bazar, tokopi palace, blue mosque and hagia sophia. I highly recommend this hotel, EXCELLANT, EXCELLANT, EXCELLANT!!! Shafiq Rashid

Reviews.Title: “A true gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seikaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almina for 4 nights, and had a fantastic stay all around. The hotel staff are exceptionally friendly and accommodating and truly go above and beyond to make your stay memorable (we wish we could have taken Aziz home with us - he was so great with our daughter!). We were always greeted with smiles. The rooms are tidy and well furnished with modern bathrooms and the common areas of the hotel are also comfortable, updated and clean. The free wifi is a nice touch. Good tasty breakfast, plenty of variety. The location could simply not be any better - close walking distance to mostly everything on the European side. Yes, the trains do run very close to that area, but they seem to stop at night and start again in the morning so we were not bothered by them at all and didn't lose a minute of sleep from them. I've never written a review for anywhere we've stayed before, but the Almina is special and deserves the praise. Hope to go back to Istanbul someday and will definitely stay at the Almina again. Value for money, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, shame about the trains”
Reviews.Author: BrerAndRoland
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel can certainly teach many others about customer service. Nothing was too much trouble, from changing the room, to lending a laptop free for internet access, to offering coffee while we were waiting for our taxi. Look at the visitors book and you will see lots of glowing reports from visitors around the globe. The rooms are fresh, clean and modern and breakfast is a good standard, albeit the only hot food on offer was eggs. The hotel is situated only a five minute stroll from the blue mosque. BUT...(and this is a BIG but) it is located right next to the railway, with trains thundering through at all times of the day and night. It doesn't matter which side of the hotel you are on, the ground shakes every time a train goes through. The lower you are, the better, but sitting on the second floor at breakfast with the windows open you really get the full volume effect!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good value, couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: TDA_rep
Reviews.Content: We booked the Almina last minute and got a great deal, They do several special offers which when combined made this a real bargain. The hotel is well located, the staff are more than helpful, and the rooms are great. Comfortable beds, and good services. We took advantage of the sauna, turkish bath and steam room, and all in all had a very good stay. For such a well located hotel in Istanbul, I could not recommend this hotel more. Thanks to the staff for being so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: chitohito
Reviews.Content: The Almina Hotel is in the center of Istanbul but away from the maddening tourist areas. It's a short walk to the Blue Mosque and the Hag Sophia. The staff are so friendly and always ready to serve us with their smiles. Cemil and Nasrin at the front desk are always concern about our stay. The security, maintenance, 'jack of all trade guy' Azziz is always there to make sure that our stay is comfortable and safe. We stayed for half a month so the Almina became our second home. We love the local grocery store near the hotel and the local fruit vendor around the corner. Breakfast is great with Zeynep serving us every morning. The people at the Almina made our stay a comfortable and memorable one. A truly home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: di0g0
Reviews.Content: Almina Hotel was a good surprise. The location is perfect. Right behind Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque) it is possible to walk to every major historical and cultural attractions in Istanbul. The breakfast is very good, with several types of cheese, fruits, and sweets. The personnel is very nice and always ready to help. The room is quite nice and the bathroom is gorgeous! I definitely recommend it! :)

Reviews.Title: “A nice Surprize!”
Reviews.Author: vi0le
Reviews.Content: i ve been in Istanbul zillions of times. Unlke other visitors, i usually stay in friends house so i don't have many hotels in mind.. except Almina. Is the 2nd hotel i visit in Istanbul and i don't think i 'll ever look for an other one! Excellent LOCATION.. in the heart of ISTANBUL... public transport is next door, the train station is 2 steps next door, Great places to get lost and explore istanbul is oN YOUR WAY!! i will not talk abou the money value cause it has been comment possitively... it has been also said that it is noisy... It is not noisy.. it is ISTANBUL.. this is how suppose to be.. If you are coming from a small little village in the country side, never seen a big city.. you will find it noisy.. (as i found boring the country side). Almina is a hotel defenately i will reccoment (and i do) ....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at the center of Istanbul and friendly staff ...”
Reviews.Author: meli56
Reviews.Content: I have been i n this hotel several times. I should say this is just a perfect hotel with an easy access to the most amenities, restaurants and places to see. And it has such a helpfull and professional staff that helps you with everything and anything. I have to sat that it was the perfect stay in Almina Hotel Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey2
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to our 4 nights in Istanbul. But, our experience at Almina Hotel led us to a rocky start. I arranged an airport transfer iwth the hotel weeks in advance, and re-confirmed 2 days before. But, they did not show up. Then, we arrived to be escorted to a room in the basement with no windows with two single beds. I had booked a double. They then moved us to a double - also in the basement. It was the smallest room I'd ever been in. No walking space on either side of the bed. No place for our (small) bags. And, it smelled like mold. My allergies are hardly ever a problem, but they kept me up that night - couldn't breathe because of the mold. We called lots of hotels and finally found one with space - so we transferred the next day. But, Almina made us pay for another night because we were cancelling 3 of our 4 nights. They offered to move us to a room upstairs, but by then we were just ready to go. My suggestion - if you stay here, specify "no basement room". Good location though.

HotelInfo.Name: Almina Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kucukayasofya Cad | Akbiyik Degirmeni Sk No:27, Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
